title: ICE in rustc

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
### Code ```Rust use mediatype::MediaType; fn main() { let mime_types: Vec = vec![]; mime_types.iter().filter(is_allowed); } fn is_allowed(_media_type: &MediaType) -> bool { true } ``` see [this repo][1] for a complete reproduction. ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.68.2 (9eb3afe9e 2023-03-27) binary: rustc commit-hash: 9eb3afe9ebe9c7d2b84b71002d44f4a0edac95e0 commit-date: 2023-03-27 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.68.2 LLVM version: 15.0.6 ``` ### Error output ``` Checking patch-calibre-desktop-files v0.1.0 (/home/jscdev/dev/projects/all/rust-ice-repro) error: internal compiler error: compiler/rustc_infer/src/infer/region_constraints/mod.rs:568:17: cannot relate bound region: ReLateBound(DebruijnIndex(0), BoundRegion { var: 1, kind: BrNamed(DefId(0:7 ~ patch_calibre_desktop_files[23b1]::is_allowed::'_#1), '_) }) <= '_#0r thread 'rustc' panicked at 'Box', /rustc/9eb3afe9ebe9c7d2b84b71002d44f4a0edac95e0/compiler/rustc_errors/src/lib.rs:987:33 stack backtrace: 0: 0x7f2ab836659a -
